result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus N Silva-Cruz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesus N Silva-Cruz in court.  Attorney Annette E Rauch in court for Jesus N Silva-Cruz.  Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Scheduling  Conference. 
Defense request a resolution hearing.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing.  
Defense advised plea documents to be submitted to the court 24-hours in advance of the hearing. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Parties advised this hearing will be held in person.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request a resolution date. 
Defense  advised to the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jesus N Silva-Cruz in court with Attorney Annette E Rauch; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 19, Judge Cimpl. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed by Attorney Rauch.

Adjustment Number: 22A 074074,
Payable Number: 1023954,
Receipt Number: 22RP031214,
Amount: $20.00
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Jesus N Silva-Cruz in court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/27/22 @ 2:30p
